metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9862 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer signedness error in bspatch.c in bspatch in bsdiff, as used inApple OS X before 10.11.6 and other products, allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap-based bufferoverflow) via a crafted patch file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdiff - 4.3-15+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bsdiff package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3-15+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
